page.title: 08 Long Bennington in 1985
page.content: {Long Bennington}is a linear development along a major route_way linking the{North of England}with the {South.}Originally the many Inns provided stopping places for horse transport.{Dick Turpin}is reputed to have stayed at{Peacock Farm,}a private house in the grounds of which a haulage firm now operates.{Long {Bennington}has been influenced by a major route passing through it for centuries, and this is shown by the varied character of the village. The people give a friendly welcome to passers_by and new residents. Since {1967}the{A1}has by_passed the village. According to a questionnaire filled in by local residents,the quietness and easy access to nearby towns encourages people to move to the village. The wide Main Road is used by a cycling club for weekend races.
